posts.title: Prompt design
posts.description: Prompting is like web design. Let’s call it prompt design, and build better tools for it.

posts.description: A primer on inference math and an examination of the surprising costs of Llama.

posts.title: Our problems
posts.description: A list of problems we are excited to solve for Cursor.

posts.title: Editing Files at 1000 Tokens per Second
posts.description: A new model and inference method for high-accuracy full-file edits at 1000 tokens/s.

posts.title: More problems
posts.description: Several exciting problem areas for the next phase of AI-programming.

posts.title: Series A and Magic
posts.description: We’ve raised $60M to create a magical tool with the aim of writing the world’s software.

posts.title: Iterating with shadow workspaces
posts.description: Hidden windows and kernel-level folder proxies to let AIs iterate on code without affecting the user.

posts.description: We’re teaming up to build the next phase of AI coding.

posts.title: Character Prefix Conditioning
posts.description: A clever algorithm for more accurate code completion sampling.

posts.description: Announcing the next-generation Cursor Tab model.

posts.title: Series B and Automating Code
posts.description: We’ve raised $105M to further our mission of automating code.

posts.title: Early team
posts.description: Lots of great people are behind Cursor! Here are some.

posts.title: Series C and Scale
posts.description: We’ve raised $900m to push the frontier of AI coding research.

posts.title: Updates to Ultra and Pro
posts.description: In collaboration with the model providers, we’re introducing a $200 / mo tier for power users.

posts.title: Cursor on web and mobile
posts.description: Work with a powerful coding assistant anywhere with the Cursor Agent on web and mobile.

posts.title: Clarifying our pricing
posts.description: How the new Pro plan works and why we changed our pricing.

posts.title: Bugbot is out of beta
posts.description: Automatically review your PRs with Bugbot.

posts.title: GPT-5 is now available in Cursor
posts.description: This is OpenAI's most powerful model, and we've found it to be quite effective for coding.

posts.title: Cursor Agent CLI
posts.description: You can now use Cursor Agent from the CLI or headless in any environment.

posts.title: Updates to Teams and Auto
posts.description: Variable requests for teams and competitive pricing for Auto.

posts.title: Bringing the Cursor Agent to Linear
posts.description: You can now trigger Cursor Background Agents directly from Linear, helping you fix bugs, build features, and respond quickly to user feedback.

posts.title: 1.5x faster MoE training with custom MXFP8 kernels
posts.description: Achieving a 3.5x MoE layer speedup with a complete rebuild for Blackwell GPUs.

posts.title: Improving Cursor Tab with online RL
posts.description: Our new Tab model makes 21% fewer suggestions while having 28% higher accept rate.

posts.title: Improving Java support in Cursor
posts.description: We're speeding up the Java Language Server Protocol (LSP) and VS Code ecosystem.

posts.title: Introducing Plan Mode
posts.description: Cursor can now create plans, research your codebase, and run agents for significantly longer.

posts.title: Introducing Cursor 2.0 and Composer
posts.description: A new interface and our first coding model, both purpose-built for working with agents.

posts.title: Composer: Building a fast frontier model with RL
posts.description: Composer is our new agent model designed for software engineering intelligence and speed.

posts.title: Cloud Agents
posts.description: Cloud agents make it easy to run many agents at once, without requiring your laptop to stay connected to the internet.

posts.title: Introducing Cursor for Enterprise
posts.description: Cursor is used by tens of thousands of enterprises, including Salesforce, NVIDIA, and PwC, to accelerate product velocity and build durable software.

posts.title: Improving agent with semantic search
posts.description: Semantic search significantly improves coding agent performance with 12.5% higher accuracy, improves code retention and decreases dissatisfied user requests.

posts.title: The productivity impact of coding agents
posts.description: A new study from the University of Chicago finds that companies merge 39% more PRs after Cursor's agent became the default.

posts.title: Past, Present, and Future
posts.description: We raised our Series D of $2.3B and have passed $1B in annualized revenue.

posts.title: Improving Cursor’s agent for OpenAI Codex models
posts.description: How we updated our agent harness to support GPT-5.1-Codex-Max.

posts.title: Introducing Debug Mode: Agents with runtime logs
posts.description: Debug Mode helps you reproduce and fix the most tricky bugs.

posts.title: A visual editor for the Cursor Browser
posts.description: Bringing design and engineering closer together.

posts.title: Graphite is joining Cursor
posts.description: Graphite has entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by Cursor.

posts.title: Hooks for security and platform teams
posts.description: We're partnering with ecosystem vendors who have built hooks support with Cursor.

posts.title: Dynamic context discovery
posts.description: As models improve as agents, we've found success by providing fewer details up front, making it easier for the agent to pull relevant context on its own.

posts.title: Best practices for coding with agents
posts.description: A comprehensive guide to working with coding agents, from starting with plans to managing context, customizing workflows, and reviewing code.

posts.title: Scaling long-running autonomous coding
posts.description: We've been experimenting with running coding agents autonomously for weeks at a time.

posts.title: Building a better Bugbot
posts.description: How we used a custom AI-driven metric to systematically improve Bugbot.
